title: Pope Leo XIV visits Blue Mosque in Istanbul on Turkey trip
snippets: The Head of the Catholic Church, Pope Leo, visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque as part of his four-day trip to Turkiye.
It is the first time Leo has attended a Muslim place of worship since he took up the papacy in May.

Breaking from tradition, Pope Leo XIV refrained from praying at Istanbul's iconic mosque, seemingly to the surprise of the Vatican.The visit, which will also take him to Lebanon, is his first abroad as pope.
Pope removes shoes but doesn't pray on visit to Istanbul's Blue Mosque Reuters
Leo XIV is being closely watched on an inaugural trip to Turkey and Lebanon to spread a message of peace and outreach.
On his last day in Turkey, Leo XIV visited Istanbul’s Blue Mosque where, unlike his two most recent predecessors, he did not visibly pray. The pope heads to Lebanon on Sunday.

Unlike his recent predecessors, he did not pray during the visit, though he removed his shoes in line with tradition. The visit is part of a four-day trip to Turkey and Lebanon focused on peace and outreach.

title: Hong Kong mourns after deadly fire in tall building kills 128

Hong Kong is beginning a period of three days of mourning for the victims of the city's deadliest fire since 1948. China has launched a fire safety inspection campaign for high-rise buildings across the country.
After Beijing reshaped the political order in Hong Kong in its image, the fire has become a test of how well that new system can govern in a crisis.

China has launched a nationwide fire safety inspection campaign targeting high-rise and public buildings.
